Label:
Consumer
protection
tools
Description:
Voluntary tools offered by
gambling companies to
help consumers manage
their gambling

Label: Restrictions
Description:
Limits or restrictions on
how and what people
can gamble on (typically
mandated by government)

Label:
Product
design
Description:
Changes to gambling
products or environments
that facilitate safer gambling

Label:
Operator
comms
Description:
Communication by companies
to their customers about
safer gambling

Label:
Public
health
campaigns
Description:
Mass regional or national
campaigns designed to
discourage gambling or
promote responsible
gambling

Label:
Risk
assessment
Description:
Assessments of player risk
made by gambling companies

Label:
Blocking
tools
Description:
Tools offered by external
organisations or companies
(e.g., banks) to help block
access to gambling products
or related spending

Label:
Self-
assessments
Description:
Online assessments of problem
gambling/ gambling harms

Label:
Self-imposed
limits
Description:
Voluntary limits on expenditure
or play time selected by
consumers

Label:
Account
deactivation
Description:
Ability to voluntarily deactivate
one's account permanently
or temporarily

Label:
Financial
restrictions
Description:
Limits on expenditure,
losses, or payment methods
applied to all consumers

Label:
Activity
restrictions
Description:
Restrictions on the types
or ways of gambling available
to all consumers

Label:
Limit
anchors
Description:
Potential value amounts shown
to consumers when setting a
limit that are low and thereby,
in theory, encourage them to
set lower limits

Label: Messaging
Description:
Prevention messages sent by
gambling companies to their
customers are typically called
"warning" or "responsible
gambling" messages (see
subtypes for more details)

Label:
Direct
contact
Description:
Direct consumer contact
via email/ phone/ in person
by the company to discuss
safer gambling

Label:
Product
labelling
Description:
Government mandated labelling
on gambling products (e.g.,
electronic gaming machines)
to provide consumers with
information (e.g., house-edge)
or warn them about gambling
harms

Label:
Advertising
campaigns
Description:
TV or static adverstisements
(e.g., billboards, posters)
warning of gambling risks
or safer gambling messages
within gambling company
advertisements

Label:
Affordability
checks
Description:
An assessment of consumer ability
to afford their spending performed
by the company. This can be done
at a broad level using measures of
post-code affluence, or individually
by checking for bankruptcies, court
judgements, or the use of credit
reference agencies.

Label:
Player
monitoring
Description:
Monitoring consumers in-person
or via personal account data
to detect signs of escalating
or risky gambling

Label:
Spending
blocks
Description:
Tools that prevent spending
on gambling

Label:
Access
blocks
Description:
Tools that block access to
gambling apps, sites, or
venues

Label:
Global
deposit
limit
Description:
A site- or venue-level restriction on
how much money a consumer
can deposit into their account over
a specified period of time (e.g., a
month)

Label:
Global
loss
limit
Description:
A site- or venue level restriction
on how much money a consumer
can lose over a specified period
of time (e.g., a month)

Label:
Global
stake
limit
Description:
A site- or venue-level restriction
on how much money a consumer
can stake in any single bet

Label:
Banning
credit card
payments
Description:
Preventing the use of credit
cards for gambling deposits/
payments

Label:
Banning types
of gambling
Description:
Prohibiting types of gambling
such as electronic gaming
machines or sports wagering

Label:
Banning ways
of gambling
Description:
Prohibiting means of gambling
such as the ability to place
in-game bets

Label:
Warning
messages
Description:
Messages that warn about
problem gambling or
gambling harms

Label:
Informative
messages
Description:
Messages that present
information about safer
gambling (e.g., house-edge
or misconceptions about
chances of success)

Label:
Self appraisal
messages
Description:
Messages that encourage
people to consider the extent
or impact of their gambling

Label:
Bank
gambling
blocks
Description:
A tool offered by banks that
allows their customers to
block transactions relating to
gambling using the merchant
category code

Label:
Blocking
software
Description:
Private company developed
software which prevents
access to gambling sites
and apps on mobile and
PC (e.g., GamBlock)
